definition: Refers to a thousand-year period before the Common Era, commonly used in historical and archaeological contexts.

An increase or intensification of actions or phenomena. In the context of the article, it refers to the significant growth in the area occupied by permanent settlements in southern Mesopotamia, particularly around the city of Uruk. This term highlights the rapid development and expansion of urban centers during that period.
